questions.question: What time are you willing to wake up for a park day?

knowledgeCard.title: Early Entry & Rope Drop
knowledgeCard.content: Disney offers Early Theme Park Entry (30 min early for resort guests). Universal has Early Park Admission for certain hotels. 'Rope drop' means being at the park when it opens â€” this is THE best time for short waits on headliner rides. Parks often open at 8 or 9 AM, meaning a 6-7 AM wake-up.

questions.question: How many miles of walking can you comfortably do in a day?

knowledgeCard.title: Walking at the Parks
knowledgeCard.content: A typical park day involves 8-15 miles of walking! Comfortable shoes are essential. If walking is a concern, Disney rents wheelchairs ($12/day) and ECVs ($50/day). Taking breaks and sitting for shows helps. Average step count: 20,000-30,000 per day.

knowledgeCard.title: Florida Weather

questions.question: Do you want a midday break back at the hotel?

knowledgeCard.title: The Midday Break Strategy
knowledgeCard.content: Many experienced park-goers do 'rope drop to lunch, hotel break, then evening return.' This avoids peak heat (1-4 PM), lets you recharge, and the parks are often less crowded in the evening. However, it means potentially missing some park time.
